creditline:
The William M. Ladd Collection
Gift of Herschel V. Jones, 1916
description: Night scene with figures and horses
text: The prolific printmaker Charles-Émile Jacque was renowned for rural scenes featuring cows, horses, and other farm animals. Here, the horses of guests arriving after dark at a country inn are brought to the stable. Accentuating the shadowy atmosphere, the figures are illuminated only by light from a single lantern held by a laborer. Jacque greatly admired the etchings and drypoints of Rembrandt, whose dramatic night scenes likely served as the model for this print.
title: The Inn
